content: And how many Republicans could spare the time to bring Joy to our men and woman in Iraq and Afghanistan? I don't have a problem with people who don't like Frankens politics, but he unlike the Great Hero's in the Republican Party, actually went to these places to entertain our men and woman, support our men and woman. He did MORE than talk - No wonder he's hated so much. Just as they hated Max Cleland, and called him a coward. They called him a coward AND a traitor because next to him, they were low lifes. Dave

More "votes" being cast for Franken than there are registered voters, (in some counties)? Are you really that stupid? Ordinarily, if Coleman were a gentleman and a professional, he would quit before he gets further behind. But the Republican machine has made it well known that they intend to keep this tied up in court as long as possible solely to ensure that Franken is able to serve as little time in the Senate as possible during this term.

content: quote: Originally posted by stec74: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: And how many Republicans could spare the time to bring Joy to our men and woman in Iraq and Afghanistan? I don't have a problem with people who don't like Frankens politics, but he unlike the Great Hero's in the Republican Party, actually went to these places to entertain our men and woman, support our men and woman. Dave How many Republicans could take the time to go to Iraq and entertain our troops? Let's see. Trace Adkins, Toby Keith, Bruce Willis, Brooks and Dunn, Kid Rock, Ted Nugent, Drew Carey, Vince Vaughn, Chuck Norris, and Jessica Simpson to name a few. I bet "dollars to donuts" that the troops in Iraq would rather see any of the above celebrities over Al Franken. And are they running for office as well, and being called "Cheap shysters?" But I'll bet you're wrong about all the above being appreciated mor than Franken (except Jessica Simpson - I'll give you a bye on her.) Frankens a very funny man when he's doing his act. And he's been in Iraq and Afghanistan, Seven Tiimes. There are some interesting links in the below article quote: Bill O'Reilly, Al Franken and George Clooney Bill O'Reilly continued complaining about the lack of entertainers visiting Afghanistan last night with guests Connie Stevens and Tom Arnold. So far BOR has been able to avoid mentioning Al Franken's USO visits there and interestingly enough, viewers did not hear either Tom Arnold or USO President, Edmund Powell utter Franken's name during their appearances on The Factor. Connie Stevens who has been really out of the spotlight lamented the lack of entertainers volunteering for USO tours. Stevens claimed the new generation of entertainers are more selfish and O'Reilly agreed. Tom Arnold talked about his experiences entertaining the troops in Afghanistan objecting slightly to the suggestion that entertainers are too selfish to go. O'Reilly concluded that the USO needs to be more proactive about recruiting people and once again, Arnold offered a mild objection noting the scheduling issues involved in organizing a tour. Somehow, O'Reilly thinks he can avoid mentioning Franken's visits to Afghanistan in 2003 or 2006. During Arnold's brief defense of entertainers last night, he mentioned that some had even faced the danger of going to Darfur. The subject was ignored totally since O'Reilly might have been forced to congratulate George Clooney and Don Cheadle for receiving the prestigious 2007 Peace Summit Award for their work in Darfur. "http://www.newshounds.us/2007/11/30/bill_oreilly_al_franken_and_george_clooney.php"

content: quote: Originally posted by shades_of_grey: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: quote: Originally posted by shades_of_grey: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Man in diaper vs A Republican.... Guess who lost that one?....lol Election fraud is the only "winner" in the Coleman v Franken contest.. and the whole of Minnesota's population are the losers here. That's right damn it, it's fraud if a Democrat wins, it's fair and balanced if a Republican wins. You're seriously going to defend the sham of a "recount" that occured in this race? Poll workers "finding" boxes of uncounted votes in their cars that are ruled "valid" and included? Election board judges holding the candidates to different standards for purposes of the recount? More "votes" being cast for Franken than there are registered voters, (in some counties)? Are you really that stupid? I guess every judge and panel of judges who has heard the case so far is that stupid. Franken's lead keep growing What else you got? Ordinarily, if Coleman were a gentleman and a professional, he would quit before he gets further behind. But the Republican machine has made it well known that they intend to keep this tied up in court as long as possible solely to ensure that Franken is able to serve as little time in the Senate as possible during this term.

content: quote: Originally posted by stec74: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: And how many Republicans could spare the time to bring Joy to our men and woman in Iraq and Afghanistan? I don't have a problem with people who don't like Frankens politics, but he unlike the Great Hero's in the Republican Party, actually went to these places to entertain our men and woman, support our men and woman. He did MORE than talk - No wonder he's hated so much. Just as they hated Max Cleland, and called him a coward. They called him a coward AND a traitor because next to him, they were low lifes. Dave How many Republicans could take the time to go to Iraq and entertain our troops? Let's see. Trace Adkins, Toby Keith, Bruce Willis, Brooks and Dunn, Kid Rock, Ted Nugent, Drew Carey, Vince Vaughn, Chuck Norris, and Jessica Simpson to name a few. I bet "dollars to donuts" that the troops in Iraq would rather see any of the above celebrities over Al Franken. And are they running for office as well, and being called "Cheap shysters?" But I'll bet you're wrong about all the above being appreciated mor than Franken (except Jessica Simpson - I'll give you a bye on her.) Frankens a very funny man when he's doing his act. And he's been in Iraq and Afghanistan, Seven Tiimes. There are some interesting links in the below article quote: Bill O'Reilly, Al Franken and George Clooney Bill O'Reilly continued complaining about the lack of entertainers visiting Afghanistan last night with guests Connie Stevens and Tom Arnold. So far BOR has been able to avoid mentioning Al Franken's USO visits there and interestingly enough, viewers did not hear either Tom Arnold or USO President, Edmund Powell utter Franken's name during their appearances on The Factor. Connie Stevens who has been really out of the spotlight lamented the lack of entertainers volunteering for USO tours. Stevens claimed the new generation of entertainers are more selfish and O'Reilly agreed. Tom Arnold talked about his experiences entertaining the troops in Afghanistan objecting slightly to the suggestion that entertainers are too selfish to go. O'Reilly concluded that the USO needs to be more proactive about recruiting people and once again, Arnold offered a mild objection noting the scheduling issues involved in organizing a tour. Somehow, O'Reilly thinks he can avoid mentioning Franken's visits to Afghanistan in 2003 or 2006. During Arnold's brief defense of entertainers last night, he mentioned that some had even faced the danger of going to Darfur. The subject was ignored totally since O'Reilly might have been forced to congratulate George Clooney and Don Cheadle for receiving the prestigious 2007 Peace Summit Award for their work in Darfur. "http://www.newshounds.us/2007/11/30/bill_oreilly_al_franken_and_george_clooney.php"
